text:
The New Penthouse Ballroom on the 50th floor of four seasons hotel atlanta Published on : Friday, August 14, 2015
Launching in late summer 2015, Four Seasons Hotel Atlanta will unveil a luxurious, contemporary wedding experience for couples: a newly-designed Penthouse Ballroom, including terraces featuring sweeping, panoramic views of the Downtown, Midtown and Buckhead skylines, as well as Piedmont Park.
The spacious ballroom will provide couples with two large spaces perfect for hosting both a ceremony and a reception for up to 150 guests. The space is also easily customised for other wedding-related events, including welcome and hospitality suites, rehearsal dinners and farewell brunches. Guests are also invited to take rejuvenation to new heights with group spa experiences for the wedding party and their guests in one of the Penthouse Ballroom’s private rooms.
An easily-accessible private elevator and hostess station, as well as private security, will ensure couples and their guests have a seamless day that befits the personalised service intrinsic to Four Seasons Hotel Atlanta.
Designed by the noted New York-based design firm Meyer Davis, the Penthouse Ballroom’s decor brings a sleek, modern sensibility to couples looking for a fresh take on tradition, with carpet and walls in metallic, platinum tones and soft furnishings with contemporary lines. Modern tables and chairs, as well as a built-in bar and twin terraces with stunning views, turn a glamorous event into an unforgettable experience.
“We consider this the ‘presidential suite’ of spaces for wedding events,” says Claudia Aguas, Director of Catering for Four Seasons Hotel Atlanta. “Couples can exchange vows high above the skyline’s twinkling lights – with ample room for celebrating and the thoughtful, intuitive Four Seasons service our guests have come to depend upon. This space offers a truly personalised event experience for modern couples.”
Aguas encourages couples to marry their “passion points” to the flexibility of the high-concept space, which can be executed in a variety of ways, including the menu.
“A Champagne bar and an all-white inspired menu provide the perfect no-stress, no-mess experience for the bride and bridesmaids before the ‘I Dos,’” says Aguas. “For the men, locally crafted beer flights with easy food pairings and some Atlanta menu favourites keep the nuptial day memorable at every turn.”
“This new luxury event space combines a fresh spin on design with fashion-forward details and impeccable service — perfect for couples looking for something new,” says Rajiv Malhotra, General Manager of Four Seasons.
Source:-Four Seasons
